Reviews.Title: “AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE! <which you just might catch here!>”
Reviews.Author: bde232748
Reviews.Content: ***DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!***** This is by far the most run down, disgustingly dirty, old, shabby, uncomfortable, dangerous and rude hotel I have ever stayed in. The decor is ugly, to say the least. From the moment you walk in, you are met with posters of Venice taped to the wall, which has then been coloured in with a gold marker to give the illusion of a picture frame. You can enjoy this "bella vista" from one of 6 uncomfortable, ratty, dirty arm chairs in the lobby surrounded by a neon flashing bar sign to a bar that seems to never show up! The personnel at the desk are rude, unfriendly and above all unhelpful. Many nights there will be groups of school aged children, drinking, smoking weed until all hours, and the staff at the hotel simply shrug and say "What can we do?" The rooms are also disgusting!!!! Small, full of mould (I had to ask to move because the smell of mould and the dampness was over bearing, I could not sleep!) , the tap in the bathroom ran with brown water, the shower was uncleaned from previous guests and the windows did not close properly. They had also turned off the heat, and without adequate blankets, I remained cold all night. What is worse than the mouldy smelling room was the rat droppings that greeted my feet the next morning as I woke. Again, unhelpful staff shrugged it off and did nothing about it! I wish this review was all made up and untrue. Unfortunately it is not. This hotel should be shut down until renovations are made. It is a disgrace to the beautiful city of Venice and should not even get the one star I am giving it (i would give 0 if possible) Overall, I would NOT, I repeat NOT, reccommend this hotel to even my worst enemy - DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Seedy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TampaHappytraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a big disappointment. It's condition did not match it's website's. The lobby had furniture with its stuffing spilling out. The carpet in the lobby and stairs was wornout and threadbare.to the point of being a hazard. The carpet in our room was stained and soiled. The door to the bathroom had water damage. The Atrium and terrace were covered with debris. . This was probably once a grand building that has been allowed to shamelessly deteriorate. Would not recommend to an enemy, much less a friend...

Reviews.Title: “Owner is S.R.L.(=Ltd) Investor does not care about renovating chambers”
Reviews.Author: Stefan A
Reviews.Content: But also very positiv. The place / situation in Venezia is very good. Rather close to CANALE GRANDE and the buildings arround very pittoresque. Nevertheless the price is much to high. Look at all the pictures showing the poor situation of the chambers and bathrooms. The house, chambers, bathroomsare in a very bad condition, one execption the entrance is adequat and nice. Also we had to pay Internet extra â‚¬ 2,00 for 1 hour. Nevertheless it is an interesting adress for backpackers. Because you dont pay much, if you are ready to share one room (with max. eight in summer) ! But this room is friendly, sunny and dry :-) !

Reviews.Title: “cheapest place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kipp322
Reviews.Content: This wasn't a flashy hotel but anyone going on a budget trip round Europe will find this ideal. It was at least â‚¬10 less than any other hotel. If you want to stay in Venice not outside it then go here. It was not particularly clean - but not disgusting. The Breakfast's were excellent and they let us make pack lunches which was useful for our small budget The internet never worked and nobody seemed to be trying to make it work Excellent position in Venice though & the only place we could find that was not far to expensive

Reviews.Title: “Too many reviews that don't do this hotel justice”
Reviews.Author: traveltimehere
Reviews.Content: Having taken a group of 42 to this hotel, I can give a wide review of this hotel. The hotel is in an outstanding position in the centre of Venice, two minutes walk from the Salute Basilica, where there is a canal bus stop, only one stop to St Marks. 10 minutes walk to Academica bridge and minutes 5 to the Peggy Guggenheim. This hotel is clearly going through a major refurbishment from the roof down and they are making every effort to improve the quality of a visitors stay. The staff are very helpful and accommodating. The hotel was warm and all rooms were well heated. The rooms were clean and resident fairies did the daily clean and tidy. We had requested all en-suite rooms and this was what we received. Most rooms have stone floors but this is normal in this area of Europe. There was one room that was well below par (Room 6 has a big damp problem) and this room was instantly changed.Some of the rooms had fabulous canal-side views. Even an item lost by a member of the group was found and placed in the safe for collection.Beds were generally comfortable and the bedding was clean. Breakfast was full of excellent pastries, cakes and cereals with natural Yoghurt, cheeses and meats. There is a bar (closed on Mondays) and the bar man is very friendly. There is a light meals menu available for snacks but this hotel is very close restaurants and other eating establishments. I would be more than happy to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I've had more comfortable nights in a tent.”
Reviews.Author: katielle
Reviews.Content: I'm all for shabby chic and didn't expect a great deal for a cheap 2 star break but this hotel was not worth paying for. I appreciate Venice has a bit of damp problem (for obvious reasons) and this hotel indeed had rising damp in abundance but it got a bit much when I was awoken at 3am by plaster falling off the wall and landing on my side table. I'm not going to bore you with tales of the poor breakfast and general shabby condition of the hotel and here's hoping that the workmen that woke me up every morning will be able to improve this place. In the meantime pay a little bit more for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: zaneta m
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the "hotel" ( I would call it hostel) 3 nights and it was horrible. The floor just as pavement - no carpet- very cold and unconfortable, bathroom even worse- shower was just shocking it could easly flood the room. Room was cold, old and dirty. The worse thing about it was the bed- we had booked double room classic with the bathroom (i cannot even think how the "economic" rooms looks like) - We got 2 beds that was suppoused to make 1 double. I was there with my boyfriend and wanted to sleep next to him not on separate beds so I woke up many times during the night as was between beds so uncomfy. The breakfast? croissants and cereals. Location was the only advantage. But I do not recomend it.. I was not looking for high standards but just for reasonable room I did not find it in that hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic”
Reviews.Author: penandpalette
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by some of the reviews - stayed here 3 nights. It's a well run budget hotel. A bit shabby in parts but overall just fine for the price and in a fab location and great views if you can get a room overlooking the canal. Pretty good breakfast and plenty to eat. I would imagine it gets very hot in the summer but in November it was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible at first!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during our honeymoon and it was the least romantic and relaxing hotel I have ever stayed in unless you like the "rough and tough" type of place. Even knowing we were there on honeymoon and even having booked months in advance, we were still given a mouldy, muffy, smelly two sinlge beds room with no bathroom that was 10 times worst then my highschool or university accomodation. When we asked to be given a room with a double bed, we were told we had to upgrade (pay extra). The upgrade was an mild improvement on the bed and had a tiny dodgy shower. This put a damper on our first night. The breakfast the next day lifted our spirits slightly (was ok) and then spending the day out in Venice refreshed our spirits. Following on that the hotel was still bad but we made the best of it. I would not recommend it, rather spend more on something worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Louisa D
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I along with our two children (11 &13) stayed here 1 night on 21/10/11. We had 1 room for all of us which was worse than an old fashioned boarding house. Peeling paint, cracked bathroom tiles, camp beds broken for children, so they slept on mattress on floor. Thread bare carpets, dirty, smelt of smoke and main bedroom door falling out of the frame. Whole in landing floor outside room, just with a board put over it. Breakfast on plastic chairs and tables along with plastic cutlery and paper plates. Self serve buffet very basic and terrible coffee from a machine. Staff grumpy. We paid over Â£200 for the privilege. We should have seen trip advisor comments first. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book here unless you want the wrong room and terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: Shouldvecheckedb4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through an online late booking agent and had paid upfront for a double ensuite room for one night paying in our opinion a lot of money but it was my birthday night and we thought it would be a lovely treat. How wrong we were!! We arrived and the receptionist gave us our key to our room, up we went and walked into a very shabby room with four single beds, two of them pushed together and no ensuite. There was a bottle of wine in the room obviously the hotel staff hoping we would not notice the lack of bathroom but what we did notice was their lack of informing us of this fact! So down to reception we go to complain, the girl was very apologetic saying there had been a muddle up would we accept the wine and we can move rooms the next night, we said we're only here one night and no that's not good enough for what we paid. So she offers us dinner in the restaurant next door two courses each, starter and main and bottle of water. We went to check the menu as I didn't want a rubbish meal for my birthday and she saw us checking the menu outside the restaurant and we said yes that'll be fine. So off we went enjoying our visit in Venice and then eventually came to have our meal in the restaurant. We ordered and ate a delicious meal and when we came to pay we said who we were and the restaurant manager started shouting at us saying why did we not tell her as she would not have let us eat from their main menu and we would have had a substandard menu. We apologised saying we were not informed by the hotel of this and had we been, we would not have agreed to it. She stormed off to get the receptionist and they all came into the restaurant shouting and arguing with us saying it was our fault and we had to pay the difference. Standing our ground we did not and the poor restaurant manger eventually gave in but I assume the hotel manager would get a piece of her mind the next day. We got the impression this is a regular occurance. It ruined our evening and my birthday. We had a terrible nights sleep in the beds that we kept falling through. We complained in the morning to a very apologetic different receptionist but no sign of the hotel manager to complain to. However while on the phone to our booking agent every single person that came to reception had a complaint for one reason or another with their room. So I would say this hotel is run very poorly with shocking customer service and complaint resolution. I was sure I'd checked trip advisor before booking as I did for all other hotels we stayed in but somehow this one slipped through the net! Never again and I would recommend you don't either!

Reviews.Title: “Mosquitoes”
Reviews.Author: London4711
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in places that were worse than this, but for the money I was expecting much more. It was extremely hot the first night so I left the window open. I woke up in the morning with over a hundred mosquito bites all over my body. Not saying that this is necessarily the hotel's fault as this is a problem in Venice, but there should be screens or air conditioning... Especially when you think of the money you're paying to stay there. Moral of the story - if you decide to stay here, leave your window closed!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gsl1951
Reviews.Content: The people are nice but the rooms are horrible, worst ever in my 30 years of travel. Bed bug issue with several in our group, carpets have huge black spots, no air conditioning, public bathrooms - gross.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: ziggy_dog_8
Reviews.Content: My daughter is currently staying at the Hotel alla Salute. It is dirty, mouldy and falling to bits! To top it off, after a day out and about, my daughter and her friend returned to their room and found strange men walking through their room! The hotel had opened the room up whist the occupants were out and decided that it would be used as a walkway from the lobby to the courtyard for the day. Talk about absolutely no regard for privacy! The girls had no prior warning that this was going to happen and had left their suitcases open. To the best of their knowledge, nothing has been taken. No wonder the room rate is cheap! My daughter and her friend are paying to sleep in what is effectively a hallway! Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Beware booking at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa H
Reviews.Content: I made a booking at this hotel under the free cancellation clause. However, when I did subsequently cancel, my account was debited and though the hotel EVENTUALLY admitted they were wrong, the money has not been returned 2 months later!!

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than many reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: LizTowersManchester
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely economy hotel , much more pleasant than many reviews would suggest. I wanted cheap accomodation for my partner, myself and three teenage daughters - and this is a challenge anywhere, let alone in a city like Venice. This hotel can offer family rooms for 5 - with a bathroom ensuite, and as such it is an attractive proposition. The room we had was large and, although not luxurious , was very clean and had everything that we needed , including plenty of towels and free toiletries. There was NO hint of any insects ( but be warned Venice has lots of mosquitos and you will be bitten when you venture out , especially in the evening) The hotel itself is in a fantastic postion ,on a small canal arm just off the Grand Canal , very central for all the sites. The building could be termed as charming or shabby - depending on your attitude. if you are one of those people who describe Venice as a ' smelly old city ', then you won't appreciate this place either. For me it's oldness just added to the character. The breakfast was great , plenty of choice and as much as you could eat ,the courtyard that it is served in is pretty too. The staff were very pleasant , we booked by phone from the uk and got a great deal . I will definitely return here - and next time I will look forward to it , instead of approaching it with trepidation!!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs everywhere. Not even worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: travelteacher84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and chose a small room with shared bathroom. We knew that this was going to be a small room because we paid such a low price for it and we were fully aware that it was a shared bathroom. The room, however, was pretty disgusting. We are used to staying in budget hotels, but the room even smelled dirty. There were ants crawling all over the floor. Here is the gross part: when I was getting ready I saw a large bug crawling across the bed. I quickly grabbed the closest thing next to me (which was a towel) and squished the bug with it. I laid the towel on the floor when we left so that they could take care of it when they cleaned the room. When we got back however, I looked at the towel hanging on the hook and it was the same towel with the bug still stuck on it! They must not have even paid attention and must have just picked the towel off of the floor and hung it up for us to re-use. I wouldn't stay here again even if we paid less than the cheap price we got. In addition, they say that breakfast is included in the reservation when you check in, but then they charge you for it. Upon check-out, they told us that we "were mistaken" because nobody would have told us that. Two other people checking out that day, however, had the exact same complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Booked two double rooms, got a double and a single: they still tried to charge us the full price!”
Reviews.Author: LJH186337
Reviews.Content: We booked this online via the lonely planet. Soon afterwards we got an email from the hotel saying our credit card details were not valid. Assuming the mistake was ours, we made another booking. We then got an email from the hotel saying they wanted to take a pre-authorisation for the whole booking and we had to email the card details. This was not part of the booking terms and conditions (a 10% deposit had been taken) and I was suspicious because emailing card details is very risky so in the end I agreed to phone them with the card details. Later we discovered that both deposit payments had gone through just fine: the hotel was basically making the rules up as they went along. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that there had been a â€˜problem with the bookingâ€™ and instead of two double rooms we could only have one. Obviously we protested and eventually they gave us a double and a single. However this meant my wife had to sleep in a single bed with our 4 month old son and I had to sleep in a double bed with our other two kids. Would have been hard to get any sleep in any situation: in 35 degree heat this was a nightmare. Not to mention we booked adjoining family rooms and ended up with rooms on different floors. On reflection I strongly suspect the hotel had another booking after ours at a higher rate and they gave our room away. The rooms were very dilapidated and in need of plastering, repainting and clearly had had no maintenance for a very long time. The hotel is a dump. A shame because it is a nice building in a lovely quiet location in Venice. The owners should be ashamed of themselves for let a beautiful building like this get in such a state. Now this takes the biscuit. When we came to check out, they tried to charge us the full amount for the original booking! And they told us they would not take into account the deposits we had paid online, claiming not to have received them from the booking agency. I had to negotiate very hard indeed to get the price reduced to something reasonable and they still refused to honour the deposits paid. Donâ€™t stay here. Period. Very grubby hotel, very dishonest people.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel that's rough round the edges”
Reviews.Author: itsafrogslife
Reviews.Content: OK, let's start with the positives. 1) It's cheap 2) It's quiet (off the tourist trail, and away from main tourist area) 3) The reception staff are polite, friendly and very helpful 4) It's close to the Vaparetto stop (Salute) which is just across the Grand Canal from San Marco 5) It's got a really nice restaurant next door - Restaurant Messner. Now for the not so positives 1) It's badly in need of a major refurbishment. Stair carpets worn threadbare, and peeling pain on bedroom walls are just a couple of things to start with. We had to get our showerhead replaced the first night. 2) The bloody birds outside tweeting away from 3 o'clock in the morning! 3) The mosquitoes in the bedroom coming in from open windows 4) The bathroom is supposed to be a wet area, but it doesn't drain into the sink in the floor. Instead it pools under the bathroom door, spills out onto the bedroom carpet, and creates camp in the wall. Having seen some photos of other rooms it looks like the problem isn't confined to our room. 5) There's no decent tea to drink at breakfast. Minor point, I know, but I'm English and it's important to me! On balance we wouldn't book here again mainly due to the poor quality of sleep (mozzies, birdies, uncomfortable bed).

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience”
Reviews.Author: andybond13
Reviews.Content: + The hotel location was a great plus. 15 minutes to San Marco, but tucked away from most walking traffic. Breakfast offered a wider variety than what we encountered elsewhere. The room windows offered superior ventilation. It may well be the cheapest alright hotel on the island of Venice, and the location is great for it. Even so, avoid holiday weekend pricing if you can (look up Venice holidays/feasts). - The 'classic quad' room with bathroom was set up for three (a king and a twin, with three pillows). Asked reception twice for another pillow (so we could at least have four pillows, if not bed-space) and was told that they didn't have any. From sitting in the lobby using the internet, I overheard this happen to another two groups as well (that the booking didn't match what they got), and reception's answer was that the Venice is an old city, deal with it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, cheap rooms with a cheery disposition”
Reviews.Author: MissLeahM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a top priced hotel and then this one. You cant compare the positions or the room but in terms of service, this was way above! We were greeted personally by the manager who recommended a taverno for lunch, got us tickets to a jazz club and organised his own baby sitter to look after our son! The hotel rooms are VERY basic - what you'd expect from a two star hotel but they were clean, cheap, breakfast was adequate (although packed up early) and it's really close to a boat station. I'd say stay here if you want to spend your money on good food rather than a fancy room.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: elena1974_11 Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the hotel with our two young children. The two of us were eaten alive by bed bugs, the children forunatly had thier own beds. My husband woke up from the first night covered in bites in the arms, hands, face and back. He is fine now but I have a major allergic reaction and am still covered in red patches in my arms, hands and some on the face. The moment we walked in the room we noticed it was not clean, it was very dusty and the toilet was dirty. The cutlery and plates at breakfast were also not properly washed. I would strongly advise anyone against the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost: over-priced & in dire need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: ChipoMugomba
Reviews.Content: I've backpacked before so am quite willing to make concessions when necessary but at 100euros per night and a 2 star hotel in Venice I was definitely expecting a whole lot more. I travelled with an aunt (late 50s) to Venezia for a short 2 nights stay over the Easter break. We booked the hotel on a recommendation from a travel agent in Rome a few days before as we figured it would be a better option than anything we'd hope to find on our own at such a late stage. Well a lesson learnt is a mistake less likely to be repeated. When we arrived our bookings were in order (the closest vaporetto stops are Salute or Zattere). The somewhat grumpy manager informed us that we had been upgraded to a room with an ensuite at no extra charge ~ note, we hadn't actually been informed that there were rooms with shared bathrooms. Anyway he then walked over to a door less than 5 steps from the reception area to a room which ideally would have better served as "power nap" room for staff on the late night shift or a maid's quarters by virtue of 1) the really close proximity to the reception desk and 2) the dilapidated state of the room making it a far cry from a room that any hotel manager keen to make money would never approve as a guest room. Where to begin...peeling paintwork, patches of exposed bricks in the wall, damp mouldy smell in every corner of the room, toilet without a toilet seat, shower doubling as a nest for "fruit flies & mosquitos", paper thin walls meaning we could hear guests arriving/leaving throughout the night & early morning as well as the night manager's music from his laptop...it was quite possibly the WORST hotel room ever. Upside: Because the room was SO bad we made sure to maximize our exploration of Venezia from 9am to 9-10pm ensuring we were dead tired at the end of the day & slept through the noise of passengers arriving/leaving as they dragged their luggage past our window. Breakfast is decent with the staples - cornflakes, croissants, cheese, coffee, tea & juice. Note: If have bad allergies or asthma then definitely AVOID this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bit run-down, good value if you don't want luxuries”
Reviews.Author: Julie_Southsea_UK
Reviews.Content: We were very worried after the reviews, but enjoyed our stay, with three children. Very central, few minutes to vaporetto stop, away from crowds, and cheap! The hotel is run-down, everything is slightly broken (bath was covered in peeling paint), but clean. Other rooms suffered from noise, but we were okay. No room service, hard to borrow mugs and cutlery, but staff tried to be friendly. Supermarket (a godsend) 15 minutes walk. Overall I would recommend if you don't mind roughing it a bit and want to be central.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Venice”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel217
Reviews.Content: I stayed there as part of a travel package. This hotel soured my visit to Venice because of their horrible service and rooms. The rooms were not that clean, they were as big as a shoebox (which I heard is normal in Venice), and there was no customer service. I read reviews before I went (not because I could make a change, but because I wanted to see what was in store). Most of the reviews were bad but I thought "oh it's just people that are picky"! Clearly they were all right, neveragain will I doubt tripadvisor reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in lovely quiet location”
Reviews.Author: avalonmist
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via laterooms.com. We were dismayed after booking to find the hotel had very bad reviews. However, we liked the hotel and the location which was very quiet and away from the main touristy areas. We booked a 'classic' room which has an en suite shower and toilet and I think this makes a big difference some of the rooms in the hotel have shared bathroom facilities. The room was tiny but clean and quite cosy. No t.v. but not a problem as we were busy out and about. The breakfast was plentiful not exciting but nice with croissants, cheese, ham, rolls, cereal, juice, coffee, tea and hot choc. Wi fi is only accessible in the reception area but there are comfy chairs there to sit on. We would stay here again but would make sure we had the 'classic' room. Do visit the Corner Pub nearby lovely friendly bar staff lots of locals drink there and they do a wonderful panini. Drink the local Spritz drink, campari, soda and sparkling wine everyone on the island drinks this.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBella67
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easy to find, close to the vaporetti stop on the Grand Canal. We had booked a double room with ensuite. When we arrived, we were given the key to a large triple room, which was off a small corridor and had a bathroom adjacent. However, we weren't given another key to lock the outer door, so we essentially had a shared bathroom. After some discussion at the front desk, the lady conceded that she had indeed made a mistake and organised for someone to come and prepare the bathroom and supply us with the additional key. Unfortunately, whist we were waiting, another staff member barged into the room with a single bed and started rearranging furniture to accommodate it, before we could object. It seems that communication is not a priority in the hotel, and he was under the impression that we were to be joined by 2 others (strangers) in a 4 bed dorm room with a shared bathroom. Luckily this was quickly sorted and he left (not before putting a hole in the wall with the bed). The bathroom was cleaned and prepared nicely, and the extra key was given to us. We thought that was the end of our troubles. Sadly, when we arrived back that night, the hallway was toasty warm, the bathroom was a sauna, but the bedroom was freezing cold as the heater was broken. The friendly nighttime desk guy brought us up a portable heater, which solved that problem. Breakfast was a huge, delicious buffet, and after that first day/night we didn't have any other problems, and the reception staff seemed to cheer up (they must have been having a bad day) because they were extremely friendly and helpful after the first meeting. This review makes out that the hotel was terrible. It wasn't. For the price we got (an average of 33 Euros per night on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday), it was actually far more enjoyable than one might expect. The altercations were by no means a deal-breaker. It just shows that a fairly large and run-down hotel, with staff probably working double shifts and overtime, can present a mixed bag in terms of experience. All that said, I loved my time in Venice, and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Hotel alla Saute again for that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic and charming!”
Reviews.Author: hana15
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group and the hotel was perfect for this. Its not posh but for tarvellers on a budget its ideal. Most of the days were spent out sight seeing so it was merely a place to return at the end of a busy day. The lobby was nice, the decor throughout the hotel is a little out dated but charming and has an authentic shabby chic feel. Our room slept 4 and had an ensuite. Again it wasn't modern but i liked the authentic european feel, with shutters on the window etc. All beds were comfy and both room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast was servd in a quaint little courtyard with lots of little wild birds waiting for crumbs. The breakfast itself was fine, perfectly nice continental but nothing fancy. The hotel also had a bar and wine garden which was lovely for sitting out in the evening. If its a plush luxuary romantic getaway your after this hotel isn't for you but if your looking to explore Venice on a budget, this place is perfect. I'd go back .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but spoilt by a hotel being in a very bad condition with a bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: LenkaZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel all Salute in April 2010 for three nights. It was very different from the photos shown on their website. We were accommodated in a triple room which was in a very very bad state. The carpet was dirty, the beds in a desperate need of replacement, the windows didn't have locks on and kept opening by themselves due to windy weather during the night. The room had a shower located next to one of the beds and not only didn't offer any privacy but had no hot water running. Our overall Venice experience was spoilt by the hotel and their unhelpful staff. After alerting their customer service desk we were told that the plumber was on their way and should have been at the hotel within 30 mins! Funnily enough the plumber had never made it until our departure 3 days later. The additional bathroom located on the same floor was in a hidious state as well with mould everywhere. We complained at Tourist Board in Venice and after months of letters being forwarded to and fro got a compensation from a Hotel. It was a complimentary hotel stay for 2 people for 2 nights at the very same hotel to be used withing the 6 months! We had to say no!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, yes, nice NO!”
Reviews.Author: cazzij5
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to do Venice on the cheap and don't mind a tiny room (bed comfortable enough though), shared toilet/shower (...good luck finding one with a light, locking door, toilet paper & the loo not coming off the wall....), threadbare stair carpet, complete with fag butt which stayed insitu for 3 days, and service with a snarl, then the Alla Salute is the place for you!! Get to breakfast early: when food is finished, it is not replaced, so don't think "I'll have one of those in a minute", cos it won't be there! I loved Venice & will definitely go back, but will most definitely NOT be staying at the Alla Salute. **footnote** I hope they paid the photographer a lot of money - I don't know how he got such great shots of the outside..?!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING! FILTHY! FULL OF HUMIDITY, COCKROACHES....”
Reviews.Author: raniaf
Reviews.Content: We would rather stay on the road. It was a nightmare. We checked in and after seeing our room we burst into tears. Immediately we grabed our suitcases and run away. The hotel was nothing like the pictures we've seen on internet. the room was full of humidity, filthy, dead cockroaches were lying on the floor. DON'T STAY THERE!!!!!!! It's a pity that we didn't took photos but we just wanted to leave that place.

Reviews.Title: “Just saw two girls get mugged outside our window...”
Reviews.Author: saracarrara
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after coming in on a bus through the Piazza De La Roma. (sp?) We had a terrible time finding the place. The streets of Venice were completely bare (10pm) and many buildings were covered in graphitti with boarded up windows (by bus station). Luckily a man had pity on us and literally called the hotel and put us on the water taxi. After another long dark scary walk we found the hotel. I don't know about other months, but I would not recommend coming to Venice in January for starters and definitely do NOT stay at this hotel in January. Everything around the hotel is completely silent at night and very dangerous. My husband were just out at 10pm and there wasn't a single restaurant to be found without going all the way to San Marco Square. That's a long scary walk. I was told Venice was known for thieves and pick pocketing. I just witnessed it outside our window. We were sitting in our hotel room and we heard terrible screams. We flew open the windows and saw two girls running towards our hotel and a man dressed in black running in the other direction. They had obviously just been assaulted or stolen from. It was awful to watch. It's NOT safe here at night and by this hotel when no one is around. You'd be hard pressed to find a single soul on the streets here after dark. Stay close to San Marco in January or other off-season times!! Last night I slept with a tee shirt, long sleeve sweatshirt, my husband's fleece jacket and a hood, and long yoga pants. I was absolutely freezing! There is no way to turn on the heat in the room and the front desk just said there was no one on property after 11pm to turn it up?? I'm here right now and freezing my butt off! The breakfast is slim pickings. There were no coffee cups or meats left when we came down. I got sick of waiting for a coffee cup so I went into a room with no one in there and stole one from the bar area. We left and went to a cafe in San Marco. The staff, at night at least, is aloof, passive agressive and could care less about customer service. So save your breath! Be prepared to share a bathroom toilet- thank God it was clean, but definitely inconvenient. The blankets in the rooms were definitely dirty. My eyes at the moment are totally blood shot and watery from the dust on the blankets that were left in the closet. Or perhaps its from the cat that sleeps on the chairs outside the room- which I thought was charming b/c I love animals, but I am allergic to cats. The shower is so small, water not warm enough, towels smelled like a strange chemical, they only gave us one towel to share, the phone in the room didn't work, the door wouldn't shut properly, the glass on the desk was shattered and when I went to use it spilled all over into pieces on the floor.... If you are used to staying in hostels then this is the way to go. If you are not picky at all about dirty things, being comfortable, or nice service then this is the way to go. If you just want a place to lay your head inside so you aren't outside with the muggers then this is the way to go. It could be much worse than this place.....no bed bugs or anything (that I can see). This is not a place you stay for your romantic getaway, that is for SURE. The big thing is-----I'd rather stay closer to San Marco. It's too far to walk, especially at night in January. It's not safe. In America, I'd compare this hotel to a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jenjenrose
Reviews.Content: Firstly, you have to understand that we paid around â‚¬130 for 4 nights with breakfast, which for venice is very good. Considering the price the hotel was very good and for us it was a perfect cheap place to stay so we had more to spend on food. I wouldn't recommend it to others because of a few key things that I think would bother other people more than us. Firstly, the hair dryer was broken and they didn't do anything about it, which was annoying because in January we were freezing with wet hair. Secondly and more seriously, our third floor room flooded on the first night and we had to avoid that part of the room which would have been okay but because our room only just fit the bed in it, it became an issue. The hotel seemed to be aware of it and there were stains on the carpet which suggested that it happens regulary. It really smelt too so the leak could have been from the loo or shower. When we told the hotel they said they would see what they could do and when we returned they had put a fan heater in front of the leak. That wasnt going to do much considering it was so wet you could see the water! There weren't many people staying in the hotel so it would have been easy to put us in another room but they didn't. Ignoring that, it was really good and I would recommend it to budget travellers or young couples anyday. For others maybe you should pay a bit extra somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful memory of venice”
Reviews.Author: thewingsofsky
Reviews.Content: Even though during the low season, I wasn't expecting anywhere too pleasant for only twelve euros a night, but hotel salute was such a surprise. It's right in the city center across the canal from san marco's square, and the direction given on their website makes it very easy to find the place. The building is very old and I liked the feeling of ages. Reception desk is 24-7, very friendly and helpful staff. I checked in with Johann, a very nice guy to talk to, and he helped me a lot with getting around the city and everything. Only thing though is that internet costs extra if you stay in the shared rooms

Reviews.Title: “cramped, smelly”
Reviews.Author: travelhappyMumbai
Reviews.Content: Very tiny rooms, smelled a bit. The location was good. very close to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “The Hidden Gem of Venice”
Reviews.Author: andrewgmciver
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel alla Salute was nothing short of spectacular. We communicated with management on a number of occasions prior to our stay to ensure that we had the right hotel for our visit. Lets just say that they did everything in their power to be accommodating to our needs before, during, and after our stay. They gave us a balcony room right on the canal and we didnt even ask for it, and this was at no extra charge. They gave us free wifi, bottle of wine upon our arrive, and breakfast during our 6-day stay. It was truly amazing. The hotel staff went our of their way to help us with dinner reservations, bathroom appliances, and the like. Please consider staying at the alla Salute and you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel with wonderful regards on venice and the lagoon”
Reviews.Author: robra
Reviews.Content: Hotel alla Salute is - as the name indicates - situated in the Salute-Quater of Venice, the favorised "sestiere" of anglo-american writers and artists since the 19th century. The terrific church of Santa Maria Salute, one of the most famous attractions in Venice, is just around the corner. Moreover, you are in two minutes at Piazza San Marco if you go by boat or in a few minutes by feet - walking over the Accademy bridge is an exciting experience of its own. The hotel is standing in front of a canal, it is very quiet and charming, the staff is always friendly and in conditions of price-quality one can' t afford anything better. If you go a few meters on the left, you can see Piazza San Marco, if you turn right, you have the marvellous view from the Fondamente degli incurabili to the lagoon islands of San Giorgio Maggiore and Guidecca.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect possition. Great value.”
Reviews.Author: EmilEnev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Venice very close to Sq. San Marco. Nice warm and clean rooms. Good breakfast. Not luxury but perfect for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo rapporto costi-vantaggi”
Reviews.Author: lucaandlucia
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a central position in Venice. the hotel is quite old and will go under restauration soon but the staff is very friendly and helpful. Obviously it doesn't provide 5 stars services... but do you need them when you are out the whole day to visit Venice? The breakfst is buffet, the rooms clean and the postion in town is excellent. The price... well, a bargain. Im ossible to find a cheaper hotel. I advise you to choose if you are on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely vile - you'd be 'batty' to stay there...”
Reviews.Author: aliceandsam35
Reviews.Content: There are lots of things I could say about this dump of a hotel, but the main point I need to make to anyone thinking of staying there is that ... WE WOKE UP TO FIND A BAT IN OUR ROOM. The windows had been closed all night and we later discovered that the bat had come from the attic via a hole in our wall behind the shabby wardrobe. What made the whole ordeal even more shocking was that when we tried to explain to the staff on the front desk, they seemed completely unapologetic and not even surprised - I was so taken aback by their response that I presumed they could not understand the english word 'bat' so made a complete idiot out of myself by flapping my arms and doing a (not half bad) impression of the animal in question. When I realised that they had actually understood, I had been stood there explaining myself for at least ten minutes without a word from the clerk, and eventually found myself justifying telling them, saying 'I just thought I'd let you know', as if I was doing them a favour! Finally the only response we got was 'It is normal in Venice', and a muttering of 'stupido' to another customer.. I cannot comprehend that a bat in a hotel room, in any city, could be classed as 'normal'. When my partner also tried to complain at the desk he was faced with a difficult clerk who claimed not to understand any english; although of course we then overheard him giving detailed directions in fluent english a few hours later. I completely understand that hotels in Venice can overcharge and get away with it but even taking into account the good location of the hotel you couldn't pay me to go back there. This little snippet of our stay in the Hotel Alla Salute hasn't even covered the mould on the walls, the dangerously rickety plug sockets, the dirty towels, the damp, or the bed bugs.....(!) The hotel is right around the corner from the Salute Vaporetto stop, but if you are anything like me and my partner and enjoy exploring cities on foot (and Venice in particular is, I think, best experienced by wandering around twisting streets and getting lost) then this location will be of little relevance to you as you can find nicer hotels at better value still within walking distance of the main attractions. We stayed here at the end of a tour around Italy and had to try really hard not to let our awful accommodation affect our opinion of Venice. The staff were the least friendly of any of the places we stayed and the Hotel alla Salute was the worst value for money. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located Hotel -good value for money”
Reviews.Author: IanTF13
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a stunning location only 2 minutes (1 stop on Vaporetto) from St Mark's Square. Vaparetto route no 1 (Salute stop) literally around the corner. Easy to find. Staff are friendly, hotel is clean and efficient. Breakfast is plentiful and efficient. Rooms good and warm -in wintertime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice area, easy to find, extremely rude staff member”
Reviews.Author: ediblerubies
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Salute for 3 nights in the beginning of November and had a mixed experience. On the good side: reasonably priced room in a beautiful neighborhood on a side canal for 70 euros per night, very easy to find, not far from the Salute Vaporetto stop and one stop away from Piazzo San Marco, a decent size and relatively clean room with a private bath. Breakfast was included and consisted of croissant, rolls butter jams and jellies, cereal, yogurt, juice ham and salami ( though the self serve coffee/espresso machines made lousy instant watery tasting espresso's and cappucinnos.) On the bad side customer service was sketchy at best. In all fairness it was one of the female front desk workers in particular who was extremely short tempered and downright rude and gave erroneous information. On the day I had to leave I asked for some advice about the quickest way to the Piazzola Roma. I was told by her that if I took the Vaporetto #5 I would be there in 10 minutes but if I took the Vaporetto # 1 down the Grand Canal it would take an hour. After asking around and even walking to the water taxi stop she suggested, I learned that not only would it have taken me almost 20 minutes to walk to the stop (as opposed to the under 5 minute walk to the Salute stop on the Grand Canal) but also that the Vaporetto on Line 5 only came every 20-25 minutes. I also had alot of trouble with getting WIFI, and after few frustrating hours finally got it sorted it out but the same front desk woman previously mentioned was clearly annoyed at me for coming back for help and visibly angry at having to deal with the problem. After a very uncomfortable interlude during which she got on the phone and literally screamed at the person who had signed me up for the internet that afternoon, I finally got a signal, but when I went to my room I found that the signal would only be recieved if I stayed in one corner of the room right near the door, so I couldn't even sit on the bed and use it. The phone in the room was also problematic. While I understood I could not make outgoing calls, I had been told that the phone would receive incoming calls. Unfortunately this turned out not to be true or the phone in my room was not working properly. When a friend called me at a pre arranged time the phone rang but when I answered the line was dead. After 4 trys it became clear I would be unable to recieve the call. Also there was no pay phone in the hotel. All in all if your looking for a reasonably price hotel in a cute and very quiet neighborhood but are not worried about customer service, easy WIFI connection, or access to a phone, then I would recomend the hotel, but if customer service, WIFI and access to a phone will have an effect on your experience, then it may be best to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Carolkeo
Reviews.Content: Our room was comfortable, painted a pretty shade of blue, with a Venetian glass chandalier over the bed. The room had a huge wondow that opened to an interior courtyard, so it was quiet but also airy. We had a small but adequate private bathroom. The hotel staff was outstandingly courteous, offering directions to the Peggy Guggenheim Museum, and a map to help us get around. They helped us with our luggage, too. Breakfast, included, was the usual assortment of pastries, cereals, meats and cheeses, plus a choice of uice, coffee and tea. Everything was fresh and tasty. The hotel's location is suberb -- just a few minutes walk to the vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal, and a 10 minute walk to the bridge that takes you over the canal and into the heart of Venice. Along the way, there are numerous art galleries. For animal lovers, there is a bonus feature -- the hotel's big, friendly orange cat.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: whiteheart88
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the "luxury" room we were given was covered in mould, floor walls and ceiling. Me and my partner made ill by our 1 night stay, we checked out first morning and they charged me over Â£400. The manager has agreed to a refund but is ignoring my emails, months gone by and they will not even reply to me. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Regards Rosanna Gale

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere and staff”
Reviews.Author: travelbyjustme
Reviews.Content: For the money we were very pleased with our accommodations. The location was good and the staff very helpful. The breakfast was great ..... the rooms very clean. It was recommended by our daughter and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Venice but Sub-Par place to stay”
Reviews.Author: M0niKat
Reviews.Content: I really shouldn't complain too much about this place because we found it online the morning before we headed to Venice but it really is a dirty place and not worth the 80 Euros we paid per night. We came here in October 2010 during off season. We found the Hotel rather quickly off our Salute water taxi stop. The lobby is nice and the people working the front desk are friendly and helpful. Unfortunately when we opened the door to our hotel room, I wanted to run out screaming and crying. It's about the size of a 10 foot by 10 foot room and totally cramped with unneeded furnuture. We had our bed there but also was a desk and armoir that should be removed from the room. We had no room for our backpacks or even unload our clothes for the 3 nights we stayed there. The room had a sink and a mirror. Also to my surprise, our room had no private bathroom. The bathroom is shared with others in the hotel including the shower/bathroom. It wasn't a big deal but the toilets and bathrooms were dirty and smelly. Our bed was not comfortable at all and I had the worst sleep during my stay there. The bed sank but at least they provided clean sheets and towels. The carpet leaves much to be desired and I didn't dare walk barefoot in the room or bathrooms. Also, when your neighbor uses the bathroom or opens and closes their door, it is very very loud! Do not stay here expecting to get good sleep. The only two good things about this place is that the staff was friendly and helpful and it's located in the perfect place to get around Venice quickly. It's close to the Salute water taxi and nearby places to eat. They provide breakfast for 8 Euro but you can find better places to eat for less nearby because it's so close to many nice cafes and restaurants. They also have a computer in the front lobby but no free internet access. You must sign up for internet through their computer. We paid about 2 Euros an hour to use it. I can't imagine how much they charge during peak season for this slum but we paid too much for such a lousy room stay. Please, if you are worried, ask to see the room first before you decide to stay here. I am not a high maintance person by any means and love camping and outdoors and don't mind getting dirty but this "Hotel" was not a nice stay. I have stayed at better Hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - friendly staff - simple / dirty”
Reviews.Author: bennyr85
Reviews.Content: Very worn. Heating didnt work in the room ( novembre ). Its not very clean - but okay. Heating dropped - wc did the same. Position is great - one minute from next boat stop - one stop to San Marco. Staff was very friendly. We payed 130 for one night with 4 persons - this is too high for this hotel - there are better alternatives. I saw that if you book very late before arrival you can get great pricings here too!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is convenient, comfortable, quiet and has a helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: asclavel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel three times over the past 15 years. It is very clean and quiet. It is easily accessible to all of Venice, yet off the beaten track of the heavily crowded tourist haunts. The neighborhood of the hotel is interesting for strolling and getting a sense of how some real Venetians live. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and linens are changed daily. The breakfast has enough food to make sandwiches for lunch (which I did several days) It is not a posh, luxury hotel but it is very good value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the price”
Reviews.Author: aaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Comments on Tripadvisor for Alla salute hotel differs from excellent to the worst ever. For me all depends on the price you are paying. Venice is extremly expensieve and you can pay a fortune for an overnight. If you are looking for something affordable Alla Salute is perfect choice. Superb location only one vaporetto stop from st Marco square, tourist standard rooms and building rather old but in nice venetian style. Breakfast basic. If you find discounted offer it will be the cheeapest room in venice, but if you pay full price hotel is surely overpriced. This is hotel for poeple who are not spending to much time at the hotel, not recommended for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this hotel if you are expecting two star accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Apple186338
Reviews.Content: Deciding on a last minute romantic break to Venice - our first visit - we booked the day before through last minute.com - We did not expect luxury from a two star hotel but we did expect the basics as were described in the Lastminute.com star rating guide. We had booked a double room with breakfast and understood that we would have a wash hand basin in our room and that we would have to share bathing facilities. The hotel was in a very good position - easy to reach by ferry from Troncheto - Venices long stay parking garage and also within easy walking distance of all the major sights - although NOT five minutes from St Mark's square as described on the printout from the hotel. The hotel is described as a 'beautiful sixteenth century building' The building may well have been sixteenth century but there was little or no evidence of this in the interior. We were told when we arrived that they had given us a bigger room - to sleep four! The room large had four beds which were clean. Unfortunately the curtains were hanging off their rails, there were mosquitos and evidence of squashed ones as well - three bulbs needed to be replaced, the leg was falling of my bedside table. The room was very very shabby. We then checked out the shared facilities - no bath! and the shower was quite disgusting - it had been cleaned - but the shower tray was cracked as were the tiles in the shower and on the floor . The shower curtain smelled!!! Breakfast superficially looked fine - cold meats and cheese but on closer inspection it seemed that some of the meat had been the leftovers from the previous day, as had the bread - I couldn't even cut my bread roll it was so hard. When we complained we were told that we had booked a last minute deal - I agreed but emphasised that we had expected Two Star standard not the worst room in the hotel. It may have been a last minute deal but we felt we had been misled. Do not use this hotel if you decide to have a last minute romantic getaway!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a hotel which does not provide shower or bath does not deserve the name”
Reviews.Author: gopeckham
Reviews.Content: good location, staff friendly enough but no access to any bath or shower, one toilet shared with occupants of 5 other rooms - this is a squalid disgrace. My room was very small, stained carpet and walls, mosquitoes-Alla Salute is more like a night shelter than a two star hotel- The owners must be very greedy if turning what should be bathrooms into bedrooms

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel with affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: Reetta22
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and the breakfast was great! The room was a bit small, but it was okay, as we stayed only 2 nights. Easy to find and not too far from vaporetto stop. A nice place to stay considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “SchÃ¶ner Aufenthalt in Venedig”
Reviews.Author: Himmelbauer
Reviews.Content: Hotel in bester Lage, gÃ¼nstiger Preis, nettes und freundliches Personal, sauber

Reviews.Title: “greeted with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: elmp
Reviews.Content: Hey it doesnt matter that the stair carpet is worn or that I put my foot through the old bedsheet on my first night or that the wardrobe door was missing. I was late for breakfast and they fed me, they didnt have to ask my name every time i wanted my room key,they were helpful and friendly,what more do you want? It was just fine!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap budget hotel w/o A/C.”
Reviews.Author: mokcl
Reviews.Content: Cheap budget hotel with decent breakfast. However, no A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid staying at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lizeta
Reviews.Content: It is the most horrible hotel I've ever been to!! I knew that it would be an average hotel and i didn't expect something special but this situation was totally unexpected!!! It isn't worth the money at all!! the conditions were soooo bad and we didn't even get a view of the canal. And the worst part of all was that when we went back at the hotel late at night we discovered that the room was full of bed bugs!!! we made a great fuss but nothing really happened so we checked out as soon as possible!!! It was the most disgusting experience of my life!!! Don't you ever think of staying there no matter the deal they offer you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not bad value for central Venice”
Reviews.Author: JOHANNESBURG_XXX
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel beacuse we thought Dorsoduro would be a quite area handy for central Venice and because it would give us a family room with four beds. Dorsoduro lived up to expectations - it is very quite compared to San Marco on the other side of the canal. You don't feel like you are trapped amongst crowds of tourists. In fact its so quiet we had difficulty finding somewhere to eat on the first night! The location is very handy for all the big sites - only one stop on the Vaparetto from San Marco Square. The only downside is that its a long way from the train stration (40mins on the Vaparetto) and as we arrived late it was a bit tiring for the kids. Next time I would also consider the areas closer to the station as also being a bit out of the main tourist area but also easier to get to. The room was enormous based on my previous experience of Venice. Not luxurious (no carpet!) but I was not expecting this given that we were in Venice. Everything was very clean. The en suite bathroom had a decent shower. Interesting artwork on the wall. The breakfast was pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Nalexion
Reviews.Content: We went for a â€œcity-breakâ€� in Venice long before the 2010 tourist and hot and smelly season to kick in (1 week in March) and we didnâ€™t prize the comfort and luxury that 4 starts+ Venice hotels may offer but the city sights and the cityâ€™s life so we found Ala Salute to have good reviews both in service and in prices. We found that these reviews were accurate: nice, quiet and relative easy to reach position from the Vaporretto (station Salute) with more than a generous breakfast (not very assorted though), the room clean enough and with a private bathroom, in the lobby free Wi-fi internet access and with a nearby restaurant. In other words: a budget location to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “depends on how high maintenance you may be...”
Reviews.Author: stopint
Reviews.Content: i can see it both ways on the various reviews...i found the place to be nice enough...good locale...neat area...but my room was sort of "dormy"...very basic...small as many rooms in europe are...but then again i was out in venice all the time not in my room...really only need the room to crash and shower...price was good for venice...i can see it would not be for everyone...but if you travel one bag light and really only need the basics this place should be fine...

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: Lilyfire41
Reviews.Content: Here's a tip that I highly advise you heed...stay as far away from this dump as possible! The hotel (using the loosest definition of the term) is totally run down and falling apart. The pictures I saw and many of the descriptions I read while researching the place made it seem very elegant and swank. It is anything but! I am not the kind of person that requires top notch accommodations when traveling, but this place was absolutely gross. The room had a musty funk that smacks you in the face the minute you walk in. The shower was covered in mildew, the shower head emitted only two tiny streams of water and the temp was either scalding or freezing, no in between. This caused quite a problem, because with temps in the high 90s, no AC, and despite advertising there would be one, no ceiling fan, we were taking about 5 showers a day just to try to cool down. The walls of our room were cracked, the bed was ROCK HARD, and we were covered in bed bug bites after spending two nights there. Everything in the room was soggy and damp. To add insult to our misery, one of the managers keyed into our room twice after only a few hours of us checking in, claiming to make sure we didn't leave anything plugged in when we left the room. I've never heard of or experienced anything like this! We had to work hard to not let our horrible stay here affect our opinion of Venice, which really is a beautiful city. Stay away from this filthy dump if you know what is good for you!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HOTEL AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: william711
Reviews.Content: I have pictures. Moldy showers. Threadbare, worn, dirty carpet. Broken and missing toilet seats. Sheets I would NEVER consider even sitting on. This is one of the worst hotels I have ever seen in all of my years traveling. The website is terribly misleading. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hayley-Belle86
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alla Salute was a great find. I travelled to Venice with my friend for a 3 day break and booked last minute - we had no idea what to expect, but to say that we landed on our feet would be an understatement. The hotel was easy to get to from Piazzale Roma (just 30 mins on the Water Bus Linea 1) and very easy to find from the directions on the hotel website. The staff were friendly, and the Reception area is charming. I could not rate the location of this hotel more highly - it is just a 60 second boat ride to Piazza San Marco, two minutes walk from the Guggenheim, and you can get to Campo Santa Stefano in about 10 minutes. We found the residential location to be perfect - though there aren't bars literally on the doorstep, you are only a short wander from great restaurants and its on these little ambles that you get to see the most charming side of Venice. Though we only booked a double room with shared bathroom, we were offered a room with a private bathroom which was a real bonus. The room may be fairly basic (double bed, wardrobe, bedside table), but when you are in the world's most beautiful city this is really all you need - a place to crash. Breakfast was great; the usual croissants, cereal, yoghurt, hot drinks, juice and continental cheese and meats. Venice is completely different at night to during the day, and we spent two nights wandering Venice until very late. When we got back to the hotel the door was locked (I think that my friend and I are the guilty culprits featured in another review) but the genteleman on duty let us in when we knocked, and was very polite about the whole thing. All in all, we'd recomend the Hotel Alla Salute to anyone wanting to visit Venice, especially those on a budget; the value for money was almost unbelievable, especially as Venice is notoriously expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The Website is Misleading”
Reviews.Author: egoogles13
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on a budget, and the Hotel alla Salute looked like a great place to stay for the money we were paying, even if the location was a bit out of the way. What a mistake. Let's begin with the location. The hotel is in a very residential area, about a five-minute walk from the Guggenheim and a ten-minute walk from the Galleria dell'Accademia, but don't let that lead you to believe that there is anything else in this area. It is extremely residential and is home to perhaps two restaurants and a few insignificant art galleries at most. If you are concerned about noise, don't be. It's almost eerily silent at night. Now moving on to reception. We arrived late in the evening for check-in and were handed our keys, told that breakfast would be in the courtyard garden from 8:00 to 9:30a.m., and led to our rooms. All normal for a hotel check-in. As we were about to walk up the staircase in the lobby to find our rooms we were stopped and told that our rooms were in a different part of the hotel. Alright, maybe there was another staircase. We followed the manager to the back of the hotel via a labyrinth of rooms with crushed marble floors and full cheap tables and chairs until we reached an old, run-down staircase through a door frame. Up the staircase we went. The lovely man then showed us our rooms. What a disappointment. The first thing we noticed was the smell; whether it was musty or something else I can't say. While they were large and definitely able to sleep the four people that were planning on staying in each, they were by no means acceptable as hostel rooms, let alone as hotel rooms. One had the luxury of having a carpet - the other did not. There were three beds in each room: two twins and a king. The king beds had extremely firm mattresses, but were comfortable enough, even with the pathetically thin and hard pillows. The twins, while likely more comfortable, were nothing more than glorified cots. There was not a headboard, a bedskirt, or a comforter to be seen; however, there were about 10 randomly selected blankets in the awkwardly placed armoire should we have needed one. The bathrooms were small and cramped. Only one had a shower curtain, but given the amount of mildew on it, we could have gone without. The shower head was broken but feasibly usable, but the hole in the hose sprayed water across the room and soaked the floor. There wasn't much of a view from the room, but no complaints there; that's not what we were paying for. The only difficulty with the windows was that they opened onto such a narrow alleyway that there was no possibility for a breeze, which in the summer months in a room with no air conditioning or fan was a slight problem. One of the two rooms did have a standing fan in the center of the room, which I assume made a decent difference in the air circulation. Breakfast in the morning was decent: plain croissants, croissants filled with marmalade, dinner rolls, proscuitto cotto, salami, cheese, yogurt, cereal and various condiments. The ham and cheese had clearly been sitting out for a while and were sweating in the heat, but they were still fine to eat. As far as beverages are concerned, there were four drink machines, one dedicated to water and orange juice and three others to coffee, hot chocolate and other hot water for tea (among other hot beverages). I was actually impressed by the quality of these drinks, and would strongly recommend trying the hot chocolate. Apart from that, the breakfast was a nice touch, but nothing special. And while the hotel advertises it, there was no fruit at breakfast. Not that important to me, but if you're looking for it, you're not going to find it. Perhaps the most interesting quality of this hotel is that it locks it's front doors at night so that you cannot enter or exit the hotel. A couple trying to catch an early train was stuck inside for ten minutes banging on the door and trying to get out while a group of people were stuck outside trying to get in in the wee hours of the morning, and the front desk was unmanned because the night manager had decided to go to sleep. Not only was this inconvenient, it was a fire hazard. While I'm sure some of the rooms must look like the ones pictured on the website, keep in mind that the majority of them look like cheap hostels or degraded dorm rooms. Know that for which you are paying before you get here. As a place to crash, it's more than fine, but if you're looking for a decent hotel, this one doesn't have much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and not so cheerful but did the job”
Reviews.Author: emzi1981
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights at the Hotel Alla Salute via Last minute.com and got a bargain at Â£330 for the 4 nights inc breakfast. We got a TINY box room but for Â£30 odd quid each a night I suppose you can't complain too much. The plus points were that the breakfast was very nice, the hotel was clean, there is a good wifi lounge by reception and also a free high speed internet computer in the corner, the hotel is very central (just across the water from St Marks Square). If you are looking for a romantic but budget place to stay I would not suggest this hotel but if you are looking for a budget, city centre place to sleep this is the one. Next time I go to Venice i'll be looking at 3 star and above to get a little more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms you see in bad TV movies”
Reviews.Author: Furball01
Reviews.Content: Was shown to our room when we checked in and was brought out to some prefab type structure where our window looked out onto the boiler room. Our room was small and there was mould on the shower curtain. No TV but that was not a big deal Location wise the hotel was very good although initially difficult to find. Water buses are the only was to travel and if you bring it to the ticket vendors attention that you are under 29 you get a discounter ticket and free entry to some museums. Breakfast was poor only place for food was the vending machine. I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel with Good Breakfast, Not so good customer service”
Reviews.Author: KAL717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Italy and stayed at this hotel for one night. The hotel is charming, clean, about 10 min walk from San Marco Square, quiet and they serve a great breakfast included with your hotel stay. Our room had a shower and sink, and we had to share a toilet with our neighbors which was not as bad as I had imagined. My only complaint (which is enough to make me not return) is our experience at the end of our night there. We are in our early 30s and decided to check out the bar scene and end it with a late night walk around Venice. We came back to the hotel at 3am to find the front door locked. We had not been told when checking in or leaving to go out for the night that the main door locks at any time. After knocking pretty loudly and no response, my husband had to climb their ivy fence (which is their restaurant patio next to the front door) and luckily the sliding door that connects the restaurant to the lobby was open. He found the night guard snoring in a chair at the lobby. We literally knocked loudly and shouted HELLO for at least 5 minutes, so I am not sure how he did not wake up. So, the guard had to unlock the door for me as it was locked from the inside as well. And was still hesitant to unlock it for me even though I had our room key in my hand and my husband was standing right there! If it werent for my husband climbing the fence, we would been stranded outside. Granted it was late, however, its vacation and as long as their are bars open and sights to be seen, we should not be locked out of a room we paid good money for. I recommend they warn their guests at check in that their doors lock at a certain time!

Reviews.Title: “Delicious place”
Reviews.Author: AlexandreDias
Reviews.Content: Very accomodated place, in a very quiet location. Perfect to explore everything in Venece.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more, a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TheNavajo
Reviews.Content: I honestly didn't expect the hotel to be as good as it was considering the price that I paid for my 5 night stay. Knowing that Venice can be expensive and figuring that I wouldn't be spending too much time in the hotel, it seemed logical to try and save a few quid on my hotel bill. It's 2 star rating just doesn't do it justice as it's staff and it's location were certainly 5 star. We were treated so well by staff such as Natalia and Louisa, who were as helpful as they were beautiful and the wonderful Fabio, who was warm and charming, a true Italian gentleman. The location is perfect, a few minutes walk from the Salute vaporetto stop and no more than 10 minutes walk from Zattere, where we were dropped off by the Alilaguna waterbus service from the airport. With easy access to the Grand Canal, St. Marco piazza, The Peggy Guggenheim collection and much, much more, I really struggle to think how the location of Hotel alla Salute could be better. Also well within walking distance is Campo St. Margherita. Full of lively bars,beautiful restaurants and the cheapest "vino de la casa" that I found during my visit. I am already planning my return visit to Venice and I have no doubt that I will once again stay at Hotel alla Salute, a great place to base yourself for an unforgetable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is made great by the people who work there.”
Reviews.Author: PoundMidlands
Reviews.Content: Not easy to find for the weary traveller so make sure you get clear directions before you arrive. Best way is to take the Bus from the Airport to Piazzale Roma then take the water bus from Roma for a leisurely and relatively cheap cruise along the Canal Grande to Salute. The Hotel is near this stop...but have a detailed map to hand! Look forward to a very warm welcome from Natalia on reception and make sure you take her recommendation to eat in the restaurant next door (Venetian Bean Soup a must on the colder months!) and try her Spritzes at any time! The Hotel is basic, my room was very small, but also comfortable, quiet and good value for the very low price I paid. You'll find that the Hotel is very well located as all the action is only a short walk or free gondola (!) ride away, but you have the benefit of being in what is essentially a very beautiful residential area. To be honest for the price, I can't fault this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Venice - fab value”
Reviews.Author: emmam72
Reviews.Content: Ahhh Venice, how i miss you. Make sure you stay on Venice island.. don't let anyone talk you into staying on the mainland. Venice is magic. This is a great little hotel with a great little resturant beside it. Whilst not near San Marks square, you can get there very easily by walking over bridges and catching the traghetto across the canal. Venice is not big and this is an ideal base to explore. Lovely and quiet and our toom had a canal view. Not a 5 star, but very clean and comfortable and SUPERB valuce for money.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel alla Salute is situated in the ancient historical part of the beautiful town of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: eftim55
Reviews.Content: The hotel alla Salute is situated in the ancient historical part of the beautiful town of Venice! In the same time it is very quiet part of the town and you can have really good rest! The entry to the hotel is just at the channel of Venice as I always imagine and dream! The breakfast is super! You can choose from 15 deferent meals and 8 varied types of Italian coffee. The rooms are very clean and the employees are very friendly and obliging! By my mistake, I paid my stay of 3 days twice, but the manager of the hotel refunded me back the second payment without any problems! I recommend to all gests of Venice to visit the hotel alla Salute!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel....Small Room”
Reviews.Author: theoramsAuckland
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter for only one night during February. The staff were very lovely and allowed us to check in rather early. The only thing was we were put in a room that wasnt connected to the main hotel and had to walk up to flights of stairs with our heavy suitcases, walk outside along a walkway that had only a small narrow covering and then walk to another building with another flight of stairs. The room itself is tiny, we asked for a twin room and there were two singles pushed together to make a double which is fine except the room was only big enough for the beds to pushed together. It was so tiny in fact that if one of us wanted to get past, we had to sit on the bed. Bathroom was ok, water went hot eventually. View was a brick wall so the window remained closed. Breakfast was simple but enough, free internet access with a computer in the reception area. Overall it was a lovely hotel, location was fantastic and i suppose if you get a nice room then there wouldnt be any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Really awesome!”
Reviews.Author: geographile
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an extremely strategic location, and very close to the gorgeous Piazza San Marco. Staff were not only kind and friendly, but extremely helpful. Every experience within the hotel is worth more than the price you pay, especially in a chaotic city like Venice! Travellers who come will have no regrets!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location GOOD service NICE hotel.”
Reviews.Author: oohcher
Reviews.Content: i was amazed at the location of the hotel. located at a peaceful and calm area. short walk to all main attractions. awesome view of the canals. the staffs were friendly and helpful. rooms were huge and clean. was definitely pleased with the hotel. would definitely recommend it to my friends and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: adelokey
Reviews.Content: It has got a great location, one station away from piazza st marco! Comes with awesome breakfast to start the day with. Very helpful staffs that quickly attended to our needs. Would definitely stay here again for future visits to venice!

Reviews.Title: “great location and staffs”
Reviews.Author: gingerbreadbun
Reviews.Content: great value for the price! great people and goodt location too. staffs were really helpful to help in shifting! although not the best breakfast we ever had but was warm enough to get us stuffed.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, excellent place, wonderfull location”
Reviews.Author: jerbin
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel in a wonerfull venecian neighbourhood. Near de main sites but with a typical italian taste. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. I deffinitivley came back there

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location close to St Marks Square for the true Venice experience.”
Reviews.Author: Fitzclan07
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in an ideal location. Close to St Marks Square with canals right outside the window. Staff were attentive and helpful. A lovely place to stay and explore the beauty of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the finest quater of Venice”
Reviews.Author: robra
