Reviews.Content: A charming, clean and quiet hotel in the distinguished quater of Salute, the finest and most sublime of the venetian quaters. The staff is always friendly, the location is perfect: just one short walk over the beautiful accademy bridge and you are in the very heart of the city. Moreover, the hotel is very easy to find by a short walk from the next waterbus station which is just a few meters away. If you look for an excellent price-quality-relationship, you can' t afford anything better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Silentstalion
Reviews.Content: We were 50/50 on staying at this hotel, however after staying there, we can say with confidence we were pleased with this hotel. The location of this hotel was very nice and quiet, close to everything in venice. The rooms were ok for what your paying, the shower and sink is in your room, however the toilet is shared. The bed is a little rough at times. Considering how expensive things are in venice, this hotel works out just fine. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: julia8888
Reviews.Content: Very badly run unprofessional hotel. Some rooms had no heating. Some rooms have a bidet beside the beds! Broken toilet seats, no shower curtains, an electricity socket hanging off the wall directly above the sink................... when staff were consulted they didn't see these as a big problem and were reluctant to help. They were rude and told blatent lies. One room had their key go missing and had to sleep in the communal areas as there was no spare key! Some rooms had damp peeling paint on walls and terrible stains on carpets.

Reviews.Title: “typical venecian hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo_mills
Reviews.Content: The decision of visiting venice was kind of sudden and when looking for a hotel we could not be too picky... it was a weekend at the begining of October. So we found this hotel on the internet and it seemed nice plus the price was almost reasonable. It was a really nice surpise, the hotel is central and close to the hot spots.... but also quiet. We could only book a room wthi shower inside and we had to share the toilet but to be honest it was not such a big deal... we did not spend a lot of time in the room. The furniture was old, the walls were stained and we had no tv in the room. Plus no elevator and noone to help us with the luggage. But honestly, you could not expect more in a two star hotel, in Venice, where practicly the elevators don not exist (or almost). Besides, we had free internet access!!!! and a great breakfast. The staff was great too, gave us lots of tips on restaurants, museums, means of transportation, they were friendly and always willing to help, all except for one, the bartender, very rude.... The weather was beautiful so we enjoyed our trip very much... we will definitely return to hotel salute if we ever go back to venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: rigagirl43
Reviews.Content: As crisis has reduced financial resources, I was looking for a cheaper stay in Venice Island (excluding Mestre or other islands). In general this was a pretty good option; I paid 50 EUR per night, but the breakfast price had to be added later, so it made 58 EUR per night (4 nights in total). The room was small and quite shabby, with very old furniture, but this is hardly a big problem; signs of age and decay, in fact, adds to the charm and identity of Venice. The bed was comfortable, albeit it seemed a bit too small for two adults (as I stayed alone in a double room, it was very fine). The room had no TV that was a bit disappointing. Some reviews already mentioned problems with the shower; that is true. If you are staying on the 3rd floor, be prepared to go downstairs for shower. The one on my floor did not turn warm in 15 minutes and even later the stream was too weak to be used. On the 1st floor everything was ok. The breakfast was fresh and tasty, the staff was kind and responsive, the atmosphere - also nice and relaxing (free internet available). As an old house, it has steep staircases, thus not good for elderly people or those with very heavy luggage. Location is also good; you can walk to the centre, crossing Ponte dell'Academia, but to reach Arsenale and Giardini quickly I used boats as well. Alilaguna boats stop at Zattere within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Old with Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: tarynpieh
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast, right on a canal, lots of rooms so shouldn't usually be booked up. The rooms with no bathroom still have a shower and sink. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: CharmNZ
Reviews.Content: This was a aweful hotel I couldn't wait to leave. The bed was so uncomfortable like they have had it for the last 80 years or so. Even though I was exhausted I still couldn't sleep because the bed was so uncomfortable. One of the days we were there it rained. It was a really bad downfall. The hotel actually leaked and water flooded my room. My suitcase was on the floor and all the content got wet. I asked for a hair drier to dry the bag but it kept cutting out after 3 seconds or so. They didn't have a laundry so by bad and clothes were soaked. I was soaked from being outside and could get anything dry to put on. Very uncomfortable. The other problem with rain and damp is that the mozzies come so then during the night I got bitten really bad. They did have 1 internet but they had no guidelines so people just hogged the computer without regard for anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Shoe Box at a price”
Reviews.Author: JiggyJ61
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fine, but as a solo traveller that felt they could put me into a shoe box. The bathroom was dirty, with other peoples hair on the floor and walls. The shower was over the handbasin and toilet, so had to remove the toilet paper from the room/closet before showering. The bed was hard with a 1/2 inch pillow. There was no screens on the windows, so was eaten alive by bugs. Not to mention the dead bugs, splatted on the walls (not by me) I would have requested another room, but when I went down stairs the receptionist was busy being rude to two ladies, who had no bathroom and only a double bed, even though they had booked differently. Decided at least I had a toilet and shower, which appeared to be better than most and as it was pre-paid I didn't have really have any other options.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel in a good Location”
Reviews.Author: CORINAIreland
Reviews.Content: We Stayed 4 nights in this Hotel, we checked in as normal but we were asked to wait until a staff member brought us to our room which we found out was next door in a different hotel called the Messner staying in the annex!!! After saying no thanks we want the hotel we booked we got a room on the first floor overlooking the courtyard. We had an ensuite room, it was basic but what we were expecting in a very expensive venice. There is no air con so i couldnt imagine what it would be like to stay in the peak months of summer. The breakfast was grand we filled up everyday and didnt return to the hotel until late at night. I would like to say to the hotel as someone who works in the travel business that if you are going to change the clients hotel dont downgrade them to a 1star its doesnt go down well.

Reviews.Title: “great thnx to Claudia and Luisa and ofcurse the hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnymony
Reviews.Content: Claudia and Luisa were facinating, they shuld be working for a 5 star hotel they are the perfect model for customer service that all hotels around the world should follow. the hotel is very well located and it's beautiful the food next door it's ok and very slow service. take the alilaguna boat 13 bucks just look them up for directions.( alilaguna>) now after gettinf out at the Zattere stop make an inmediate right parallel to the water go over 3 bridges and then make a left the hotel it's about 1/*2 a block on your right. on santamaria plaza there's a gondola ride company that will charge you 40 per person and will cram 6 people per gondola and then about 8 gondolas will leave with you and one guy will sin for all. the price all over venice for gondola rides b4 6pm its 80 eurs. ther's only one thing or person at this hotel i could not get her name but she was awful i am sure that she is not italian she has missing that italian warm. i would recomend this hotel to all. no elevator. and free internet and wifi at lobby only.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chenova
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel, perfect location central but away from the crowds. The staff were very helpful and lovely bar with little garden. Our first night we had a room over the garden bar which was very noisy we didn't sleep at all and extremely basic in design. I would suggest a canal side room which we were switched to the following night . The canal side rooms are really cute and great value. If you are sensitive to noise check that you dont have a noisy room.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, but rooms could be better”
Reviews.Author: surficialaquifer
Reviews.Content: In short: If you're looking for affordable hotel with a good location in Venice, this might very well be it. It's a short walk away from the Salute vaporetto stop in a residential area. The room we got faced a small, very pictoresque canal -- we very very pleased with the view. The room was very basic -- no air conditioning, no tv, no toilet. The shower was just a small closet in the corner. This was Ok since we were travelling on a budget and didn't expect much more. The shared toilet was clean. The room was a bit rugged but not dirty. Didn't have the breakfast. The staff didn't seem to much pa attention to who came and went through the hotel lobby (no key control), which seemed like a potential security problem -- though we experienced none. There's nothing special about the place, but we didn't have big complaints either.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep in a Ho(s)tel, Salute is bullseye!”
Reviews.Author: SemperFidelisCD
Reviews.Content: story short; Hotel standard really really bad. Recepion area decent, breakfast eatable. No controll on room keys... they gave out the wrong one a couple of times in just 4 days. Long story; Booked 4 rooms months in advance (After reading the absurd high rating they got here on tripadvisor), showing up, they are one room in short; (!) So a couple of friends gets moved to the nextdoor hotel (with a rule about beeing home before 01:00 else the hotell would be closed(!?). Well such things happen.... I guess. Entering my room it`s best described as a Sauna, a very small one that is. There is absolutely nothing in the room except the bed. We were promised A/C when calling, that they denied. Second we asked to get atleast a fan...that took 2 days. Needless to say trying to sleep was hard, very hard. Good side I probarbly lost a couple of punds thx to the heat in my sauna/room. When checking out we got charged for one more night, they claiming they never heard about us checking out that day. Showing the not so friendly staff our Plane tickets (allso booked months in advance) trying to appeal to their logic sense; "why would we need a room the following night, when were not even in the country"?, as well as refering to a verbal agreement with a named member of the staff. Nothing helps, have an early flight and really need to go, just paid up and left. My advice would be to steer clear!!. This is one of my worst hotell experiences ever!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bargain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharityK13
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located across the Grand Canal from the San Marco Piazza was a perfect bargain hotel for our two-night stay in Venice. The residential neighborhood provided few dining and shopping options but for the most part was a nice, quiet area away from the main tourist foot traffic. The staff were very friendly when we needed to speak with them and helped provide dining alternatives as many of the shops nearby were closed for August. We reserved a room with a shared bathroom to save money and were pleasantly surprised to find that the only thing shared was the toilet - shower and sink were located inside the room itself. There were several toilets per floor so there was never a wait. The rooms were basic and small but exactly what you would expect from a bargain room in a building from the 15th century. The carpets could have used some cleaning but the beds/linens were just fine. The one complaint we have is that it would have made for a much nicer stay if the windows had screens - we spent a good part of the hot August night battling mosquitoes and losing. The rate we paid did not include breakfast but this could be purchased separately for 8 euro each. We found it easier to head off to our sightseeing and grab breakfast (espresso and a pastry) for half as much. The hotel promised wifi access and seemed to have it - but not in the rooms, only in the lobby. As it turns out, we were so incredibly enchanted by Venice that we never picked up the PC once - and that's saying a lot for us! I would definitely recommend this hotel for bargain hunters who want to remain in Venice proper.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chriis219
Reviews.Content: If you plan on staying in Venice, be prepared to spend alot of money on accomodation unless you stay here or a couple other places on the island. We got a great rate on a quad room which contained a bathroom with only a bathtub and shower sprayer with no curtains, a small living room with a lounge chair and table, and two king beds for 4 people. The room was decent, i was expecting 4 seperate beds but it was ok. The location is great! You can easily navigate the entire island of Venezia within 15 minutes walking or jumping on the ferry. Be prepared to get lost in Venezia as it is so easy and it is a bit difficult finding the hotel so make sure you get a map and directions before hand. Breakfast was very good, considering what we paid, lobby was very nice and staff were a little rude at first but opened up after the first night. If you are looking for a decent place to stay with a great location and great prices, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: SueBrighton_UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel has friendly helpful staff, and is in a great peaceful location beside a canal. The room we had was clean and spacious, with old but functional furniture (added character). The breakfast was an all you can eat continental buffet (Cold meats, cheese, bread, cereals, croissants, fruit and yoghurt and fresh ground coffee) served in a shaded garden. The hotel was a short walk to the Salute water bus stop only one stop to St Marcs square. Best of all it is one of the cheapest hotels in Venice itself! They also offered an excellent deal for an evening meal at the restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: AM2888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night and found the hotel quite decent for the price we paid. The price was quite a bit lower then any other hotels in the area, but was still clean and in a good location for siteseeing. Upon arriving there, after a long day of traveling and finally finding the hotel (Venice is a difficult city to get around if it is your first time visiting) the lady at the front desk was extremely helpful and kind, and showed us to our room and told us to come down and ask any questions after we had relaxed and freshened up. She provided us with a map of the city, explained how to get around, and the city's best attractions. We found this extremely helpful as we only had one night in Venice and didn't have much time to explore and get lost looking for certain places. We also found it helpful that the hotel offers complimentary internet in the lobby, even though most the time the computer is being used by kids staying in the hotel. Although our room didn't have air conditioning and was a bit dated, it was still clean, comfortable, affordable and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “ok.”
Reviews.Author: chaverde
Reviews.Content: The problem with this hotel is that it has a huge quality difference between differently priced rooms. I think the location is great, as it is near of 2 different vaporetto stops, and away from the mess of the more touristic areas of Venice. It has rooms with a view to the canal, but most rooms don't. Our room had a view to a courtyard, which was ok. Overall, the furniture and bathroom was a bit dated and needing to be replaced. Also, we don't know why, but the bathtub had no shower curtain! One thing I didn't like was the way we were treated at the reception, according to the price we payed for the bedroom. The couple that was checking-in in front of us payed almost the double, and got a very nice treatment from the recepcionist. When it was our turn, she checked the priced we payed to see what room to give us, stopped smiling and then just gave us the key and that's it. So, be prepared to be treated accordingly to what you payed. A good thing is the free access to the internet in the lobby. One computer, but a working one. The breakfast is very average.

Reviews.Title: “Truly disgusting, very rude staff, unpleasant and insanitary”
Reviews.Author: june2009venicetrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 'da Cici' for two nights. After our first night (no AC, incredibly hot!), we woke up with dozens of small little bites all over our bodies. We tried to convince ourselves they were mosquito bites, as did the staff, but they were on areas of our bodies where we were wearing clothes (i.e. our stomachs, upper legs, places where mosquitoes couldn't have accessed). Definitely some sort of bed bugs. Every time we approached the staff with a question or concern we were either ignored or dismissed rudely. On top of all that, they would not let us check out the night before our 8 am flight, so we had to wake up an hour early to check out around 5am. A little side note- the staff members who work behind the front desk from 10pm to 8am speak no english, and are incredibly rude. Da Cici is an awful awful place. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE FOR CHEAPER, AND WITH A BETTER LOCATION

Reviews.Title: “A clean, charming hotel with a friendly staff in a quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: ElaineLucille
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Hotel alla Salute for only two days. I wish it were more. My son and I spent hours searching for a good hotel. There are many hotels in Venice. We picked a winner. The staff was very attentive to our requests. Fabio had emailed me several times to answer my questions before we got there. The hotel is very clean, something I think is very important. The room looked as if it was recently redone. The furniture, carpets, linens looked new and the bathroom was spotless. The breakfast was sufficient. There was an outdoor dining area as well as indoors. The outdoor area was well shaded and very relaxing. The hotel is in a quiet area but withing walking distance to many shops and restaurants. If I ever went back to Venice I would stay here again. Why ruin a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value - Away from Crowds”
Reviews.Author: Stefanod79
Reviews.Content: My mother and I visited Venice for two nights in May. We selected Hotel alla Salute based on price, it's quiet location (across canel from St. Mark's), and reviews found on this site. We were not disappointed. The staff was friendly and our room was clean/recently refurbed. The air conditioning was cold. The breakfast was typical for hotels in Venice. Overall I would recommend this hotel for the budget traveler wanting something more than bare bare bones but cannot afford a luxry hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: KailinVancouver_B_C_
Reviews.Content: this Hotel is in an excellent and quiet location and the staff are super friendly and accomodating. For a budget hotel, this was our best in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better I'm sure even in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideSammy
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice before so did have e some idea of the cost relative to other destinations. Admittedly we booked just before Easter and had limited options, in my defense I thought I had checked each option out carefully. From the exclusion list one had no reviews and there was this one with good reviews on the booking site and mixed on Trip advisor. First the positive, very good position, well it was for us anyway, close enough without being in the midst of the madness, if you are not a reasonable walker then it would be too far out of the way although it is quite close to a vaporetto (waterbus stop). Also no matter which way you arrive it is not walkable with luggage.. Secondly, it came with ensuite which we had not expected as we thought we were booking the â€œeconomyâ€� room with shared bathroom. The internet access is in the lobby, and is free and Wifi. There is a hardwired computer for general use which is almost always occupied. Thirdly the bed, which is important was very comfortable, the room was very clean and beautifully decorated. The negative- like others have mentioned and I should have taken more notice, but I thought we were OK because we had the shared bathroom, so were booked in the main hotel. When we arrived (which was late at night) we were shown our room in the â€œnewâ€� part of the hotel which barely fitted the double bed and told â€œthe hotel is full, we may give you another room tomorrowâ€�. When we asked the next day this was obviously not going to happen because we had already been â€œupgradedâ€�. The other negatives, there were no Tea and coffee making facilities, no TV (which did not bother us but may upset some); the towel heaters did not work properly so our towels were constantly damp. The hot water was just ok and sometimes just tepid. There was no room to put your suitcases except on the floor beside the bed and then no way to get round except to step over them, luckily we did not have lots of luggage, this room is not workable with more than 2 suitcases or for the elderly or disabled. The breakfast was OK for the 1st 2 days â€“at least the rolls were fresh, the following days they had obviously been frozen and defrosted (they were still frozen on the 4th day), now I understand that this probably has something to do with it being Easter, but maybe an apology, explanation would make it a little more palatable? I heard someone in the lobby ask about the lack of TV and they were told by the concierge that â€œwe prefer to readâ€� â€“ well so do I but preferably in a chair and possibly with a cup of coffee to sip. It would be impossible to read in the â€œguest loungeâ€� which is the lobby, as there were always people coming and going and the reception staff talking to each other about bookings, on the phone etc. Just a suggestion which would cost little- if anything, as this hotel obviously caters to the budget tourist, a little more tour information would help, I had been to Venice before so knew where to go to get this information but most of the tour information is not a short walk away, maybe a few brochures may help, although they do have a map. All in all, good bed, good quiet position if able to walk well, very clean â€“ that is it. would like to be more positive but truly cannot.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Place in a quiet part of town”
Reviews.Author: RideTheLightning
Reviews.Content: Im not the type of person to spend much time in my room when in such a great city for so few days. For this reason Im only interested in having a clean room with good access to where things are happening. I thought it was cute clean and in a quite part of Venice that isn't too far away from the major attractions. I loved it. When I decided to stay an extra day they were more then happy to cut me a deal and offer any assistance I needed. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful-away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: dicici
Reviews.Content: When in Venice, we would stay again with Barbara!! My husband and I stayed there for 4 nights in 2003. I stayed there in 2005 with my 82 year old Italian aunt again for 4 nights. And visited in 2008 with my sister-in-law. We have stayed at other hotels in Venice all the way from the Bauer on one end to the very basic, but Barbara at Alla Salute is the only one who took the time to make us feel like a part of Venice and her family. She is awesome!!! Yes, the breakfast is basic--but quite good. I would rather pay less for a hotel room and spend the extra money exploring to find a local restaurant for a heartier breakfast when I desire one. We as guests also need to take time to be gracious and polite to get the same response back to us. If we are blunt and gruff--that is what comes back to us!! Take some time before you visit another country and learn their words for please, thank you, excuse me, and I am sorry. Those words will get you a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelerOsloNorway
Reviews.Content: This quite, small hotel is situated in an old palace. 'Cici' is Venetian for 'Francesco', the name of the founder of the hotel. The present manager, Barbara, is his grand-daughter. We've stayed in da Cici seven or eight times since 1992 and we'll stay there again as soon as we come back to Venice. It is very centrally situated, but off the streams of tourists. You'll find a Traghetto (a Gondola used as a ferry) just a few steps from the hotel, it takes you close to Piazza San Marco. But before you visit the main tourist sights, have a look inside the church of Salute. There you'll see one of the best icons in Italy. The rooms in the hotel are priced according to their standard, but all of them are clean, quite and pleseant. Most, if not all, have a nice view of the garden. Some of them have a view of a romantic canal just outside the hotel. The hotel has a small, quite garden with afternoon sun where you might sit and contemplate the events of the day with or without a glass of wine â€“ or water. I notice that some of the people writing on this site are complaining about the breakfast. I find that absurd, especially in da Cici. If you come to Italy to eat breakfast, you've come to the wrong country. The best with breakfast at da Cici are the fresh rolls and the coffee, a delicious, foaming brew. Actually, it is the best coffee we've tasted. Have it with milk! The staff is very friendly and speaks English fluently. We got the hotel recommended by friends and would not hesitate to recommend it to others, which we also have done. Irina and Peter N. Waage, Oslo, Norway

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but not amazing.”
Reviews.Author: jandtpeters
Reviews.Content: I wish I could Da Cici 3 and a half stars, but I rounded up to 4. It has a lot going for it: Nice location in a quiet neigborhood Charming Reception area Clean rooms with decent bathrooms Friendly, knowledgable (and talkative) staff Interesting history But, the rooms are aging (peeled paint, creaky furniture), and the breakfast is only mediocre. The hotel is in a huge old palazzo, which is charming, but has its drawbacks. Of course we knew that an elevator would be asking too much, so no complaints there... but the hotel is a little maze-like. It was very long walk with some very steep stairs from our room to the front desk. Quite a hike with luggage, and as I recall, no one to help us. It was a bit expensive, but that's to be expected in Venice so we felt that we were getting a fair value for a clean room with Venetian charm.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing :-(”
Reviews.Author: Leigh007
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel three weeks prior to our trip and now we know why this was one of the few hotels still with availability in Venice at the time. In fairness the surrounding area is quiet and within easy walking distance to the attractions of Venice. On arriving the reception was relatively inviting, if only our bed could have was been situated here!!; after this, it was all just a little disappointing. The room was drab and had seen better days. Very compact but at least clean. Crumbling Venice is a joy to see, I didn't expect this to extend to our room!. The breakfast every day was the same thing: two kinds of rolls -- hard and soft -- jam, nutella, tea or coffee and a sickly sweet orangeade passing off for juice. No fresh fruit, ham or cheese here. The awning leaked on the outdoor patio during breakfast, which added to the amusement. For the premium price they charge the hotel could at least upgrade the rooms and introduce a more healthy option. As you would have gathered by my review we will never be staying here again ~ I just hope the rest of you have a far better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Break, Simply Ideal !”
Reviews.Author: simonwilliamson
Reviews.Content: Perfect in every way, charming friendly and charismatic. Excellent location , so close to the salute church, you can virtually touch it!, but away from the busy canals. Central, easy to find but away from the hustle and bustle and still only 5 minutes from St Mark's square, simply ideal ! We were made very welcome and nothing was too much trouble, everyone was helpful in every way, we are planning to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Recommendation for Hotel alla Salute”
Reviews.Author: Bluetwo_8
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended Hotel alla Salute [they stayed there in 2007]. We decided to go for Carnival this year. It was a last minute decision. When we rang, we were offered a room in the newly refurbished annex [which has air conditioning], as the main Hotel was fully booked. The room was very tastefully decorated, and we had a very comfortable stay. The family and staff of the Hotel made our stay just right. We will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful annex - be careful to stay in main hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaniNewZealand
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room in this hotel based on Lonely Planet and Trip Advisor reviews , LP referred to well furnished rooms. Clearly these reviewers were lucky enough to be placed in the main hotel. We arrived in September and were shown to an appalling room in a new annex with the following items: bed with worn bedspread, radiator with peeling paint, formica(or similar) table, old wardrobe and small shower. We paid the same for this room as those lucky enough to be in the main hotel. We thought this very cynical and were so unhappy with our room that we checked out immediately losing entire sum. Be warned !

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic. Good location and great price.”
Reviews.Author: Keith58
Reviews.Content: Most of the previous reviews - good and bad - seem to be correct, surprisingly. My room (46) was in the main building, and was clean but small with a tiny view of a courtyard - and its plastic roof. The bed was, however, very comfortable and there was an armoire for my clothes and a little desk. Reception was fine. Breakfast was, as one person said, a basket of rolls and a pot of coffee. Very basic when compared to breakfasts at other European hotels I have stayed in. But, the price was 112 Eur. a night, which seems pretty good for Venice. The location is terrific; steps from the Guggenheim museum and Salute church; very quiet neighborhood with "good" art and jewelry stores - and two good restaurants around the corner near Guggenheim - rather that the normal touristy schlock stores.... The walk to St. Marks is more than "5 - 10 minutes", as suggested by one person - more like 15 - 20 - unless you take the Traghetto (shuttle boat gondola) at a stop 2 minutes from the hotel that puts you very close to St. Mark's square. cost of a traghetto is only 1/2 of a Euro; well worth the price and the experience (but the traghetto stops running at about 7:00 p.m. apparently; so you must walk to and across the Accademia Bridge later in the night. I was mildly disappointed in the hotel while I was there, until I realized just how inexpensive it is and that it reallly is in a great, quiet location. If other readers can find a less expensive hotel with a more substantial breakfast nearby, try that hotel; but, in general, this was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonJGeorge
Reviews.Content: HOTEL We arrived in Venice and all I could say was WOW! What an amazing city, we struggled with our rucksacks through the crowds to get the our hotel. I though we would struggle to find it but we didnt, the sun was beating down and it was a great feeling to walk into a nice clean cool reception. The receptionist was fairly friendly and took us to our rooms. We were led out of the main hotel, through a courtyard to the new section of the hotel, so far I was impressed for a 2 star hotel. ROOM She opened the door to let us in, by this point I was still happy with the hotel. After squeezing into our room I was shocked to say the least, I have never had such a small room before, when she closed the door behind us it really did feel as if we were in a cupboard. It was the middle of the day yet we had to have all the lights on as the "View" was a brick wall which was only a couple of inches away from the windows so it allowed absolutely no light in. After throwing down my rucksack and starting to unpack, my girlfriend commented that there was no TV. Now I know what your thinking, your in Venice, why do you want a TV? But its just I've never stayed in a hotel that didnt have a TV. Its always nice after a long day of walking, seeing the sights, to put the TV on and have a glass of wine while getting ready for the evening. So it did feel a little quiet without one. To be fair though, the room was very clean and the bathroom, again incredibly tiny, was lovely and the shower was probably the most satisfying in any hotel i've stayed in, loads of water pressure and room to move! FOOD To say the breakfast is basic is an understatement. You get a pot of coffee, which was lovely, and a basket of bread. And thats your lot, you cant have more. It did the job and the bread was generally nice, but if you want anything other than bread and jam then your gonna be dissapointed. LOCATION Its in a very quiet part of venice, very much south of the island, and is a good walk away from the main sights, probably 15-20 minutes. While Venice is fairly safe, it does feel a little unsettling to be getting back to your hotel with deserted streets around you. Probably not ideal for sole female visitors, although as I say Venic is fairly safe. OVERALL We paid Â£100 a night and I thought that was very overpriced, although you are in walking distance from most of the main sights so thats why you pay the price. The rooms were actually pretty good other than being incredibly tiny and having the worst view you could imagine, almost no point in them putting windows there! If your looking for a quiet hotel at night, a basic room for a moderate price for Venice and basic breakfast then maybe this is for you, but I would reccomend trying to get somewhere more central of the city. A decent little hotel, very much a 2 star, and I wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Highly Recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: goldenhound
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel...brimming with charm, and gracious hosts. The room was spotless...the service impeccable...the breakfast delicious...and the owners most warm and welcoming. Our visit to Venice was an experience that we will never forget... and our stay at the Hotel was in intregal part of our wonderful trip. Thank you to everyone at "Da Cici"!!!!! Hope to see you all again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Salute!!!”
Reviews.Author: lucaBologna
Reviews.Content: I stayed just 1 night at the Hotel alla Saute da Cici last saturday 16 june 2007. The hotel is ideally situated on a small canal less than 5 min walk from St. Mark's square and vaporetto stops. My room (#24) had a high ceiling and was immaculate and remarkably quiet. The price of the room is outstanding value for its location in central Venice, considering the room. The man who own the hotel was really kind. The shower was nice, the bed fantastic. I will return soon to "Cici" without hesitation... I am lucky to return to Venice really soon.

Reviews.Title: “worth the price”
Reviews.Author: 0canuck
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on price and location. It is a quiet pretty neighbourhood. We wanted Dosoduro area. The room was small, but clean and comfy. True, we had no real view, but the staff are friendly and we enjoyed our stay. We got there on Alliliguna boat from the airport - Zattere stop. We left via car - again Zattere stop. We have no complaints and felt we got our money's woth.

Reviews.Title: “very disapointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: fjmilton
Reviews.Content: Well... were do I start?? We walked through the door into a nice reasonable 2 star entrance, and fault, yea this is quite good for a 2 star, but we then got shown to our room. We got this terrible room, we asked for a double but instead we got a 4 bedded room?!?? The furniture was VERY dated! Not in any good condition! So really the pictures in the leaflet and on the website does not look like anything it really is!! I then sat down onto the bed and I got lots of bites all on my leg.... the room just felt so dirty I really didnâ€™t want to sleep in the bed! So I went down stairs and asked if it was possible if I could have another room which was just a double and felt clean and in a reasonable place. So he walked us outside which was meant to be the â€œnew sectionâ€� which to me felt far away from the actual hotel. The new room was in a little bit better condition than before. You had a view of NOTHING!! Just a brick wall! You felt like you was in a deep hole. Didnâ€™t feel cosy! Security is very poor. We left the hotel to go and look at the beauty of Venice. Come back and found another person on reception and found us reaching out to get our key our self. They didnâ€™t even ask us what room number we were or if we were even staying there! To me that is a very poor security and a very good opportunity for thiefâ€™s to take a key, portend that they are staying there and nick all your things. The next day we even come back to our bedroom door being WIDE OPEN!!!! And the hotel keys dangling in the door! Why?? I am sorry but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone! The only good thing about it is the location... but then again there are other (better) hotels near by that are in a good location and condition.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean and basic place to sleep in Venice, then this hotel is for you. Do not expect a spacious and well decorate room. I do highly recommend getting a room with a bath! There is no AC, but you can open the windows in your room. However, do not expect a great cool breeze and silence as you sleep (at least not in the summer). Every morning we awoke to the church bells and the sun blazing in on our faces. The day staff is very helpful, but the night shift is not as accommodating. We arrived late our first night, and I had to search for a person to check us in. Needles to say, he was not so helpful or understanding of our LONG commute to the hotel. Be prepared to take 2 different boat rides to the hotel and a few bridges to lug your bags over. Ladies, the hotel claims to have a blow dryer. However, by US standards it is NOT a blow dryer. It is more like a vacuum that blows our air instead of sucking it in. After this discovery I had to purchase a blow dryer in Italy (12 Euros). Do not expect anything great fro breakfast. It is just bread with various spreads, coffee, tea and tang. It will tide you over until lunch. Basically, this hotel is OKAY in my opinion. It does the job if you are just looking for a basic place to stay. There is so much to do in Venice that you won't want to spend free time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is not too bad. It's close to the last stop on the Grand Canal (so be patient when arriving in Venice and taking the "local" (1) Vaporetto). The room was very drab - needs to be updated....would rather pay a bit more for a little more comfort and updating. Breakfast was also not great - pretty much a hard roll and jelly (and coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early July, very good value for money, excellent location. We stayed in a triple room with a shared bathroom. Was basic, but spaceous and clean, and never saw anyone else in the bathroom. Desk staff always very pleasant and helpful. Could spend a lot more money in Venice and be disappointed. Would highly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic city, lovely hotel, very friendly staff. We'll suggest this place.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel alla Salute
HotelInfo.Address: Salute 222, Fondamenta Ca Bala, 30123 Venice, Italy
